name: Alpine Creeper
description: A large plant creature that resembles a patch of lichen and is capable of remaining motionless to ambush unsuspecting adventurers.
memorable: Its ability to summon various beasts to its aid creates unpredictability in combat, and it can incapacitate foes with sleep-inducing spores.
goals: To incapacitate adventurers and call nearby beasts to attack them.
relations: Likely found near other beasts it can summon to aid in confrontations.
environment: Often found in alpine or mountainous regions, camouflaging itself among the natural flora.
strengths: Immune to cold damage, resistant to bludgeoning and piercing, and possesses abilities to incapacitate foes.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire damage, which is a significant weakness.
attacks: Uses Gentle Dissolution to deal acid damage and Sleep Spores to put foes to sleep.
most_powerful_ability: Cleaning Call, which summons beasts to attack its enemies.
senses: The Alpine Creeper has tremorsense out to 60 feet, allowing it to detect creatures around it even while motionless.
skills: It has a perception skill with a -3 modifier, reflecting a limited ability to detect nearby threats.
additional_information: Has condition immunities to being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, grappled, and prone.
Can inflict exhaustion on unconscious foes with Lethargic Stupor.
The Mossy Carpet ability allows it to navigate tight spaces effectively.
